title: D. H. Lawrence - Lady Chatterley's Lover + other works (44 books
description:
D. H. LAWRENCE (1885-1930) was an English novelist, poet, playwright, essayist, literary critic and painter.

Lawrence's opinions earned him many enemies and he endured official persecution, censorship, and misrepresentation of his creative work throughout the second half of his life, much of which he spent in a voluntary exile which he called his "savage pilgrimage."  At the time of his death, his public reputation was that of a pornographer who had wasted his considerable talents.  E. M. Forster, in an obituary notice, challenged this widely held view, describing him as "the greatest imaginative novelist of our generation."  Today Lawrence is widely considered -- alongside James Joyce and Virginia Woolf -- as one of the great modernist English-language writers.  His linguistic precision, mastery of a wide range of subject matters and genres, psychological complexity and exploration of female sexuality distinguish him as one of the most refined and revolutionary English writers of the early 20th century.

His many works include SONS AND LOVERS (1913) and WOMEN IN LOVE (1920), but he is best known for his infamous LADY CHATTERLEY'S LOVER (1928), a graphic and highly sexual novel that was banned in the U.S. until 1959 and in England until 1960.


The following books are in PDF format unless otherwise noted:


                                    == Novels ==

* AARON'S ROD (Penguin, 1995).  Edited by Mara Kalnins with an Introduction and Notes by Steven Vine.

* THE BOY IN THE BUSH [with M. L. Skinner] (Viking, 1972).

* KANGAROO (Martin Secker, 1923)

* LADY CHATTERLEY'S LOVER: The Complete and Unexpurgated 1928 Orioli Edition (Bantam, 1968).  Edited with an Introduction by Ronald Friedland.

* LADY CHATTERLEY'S LOVER (Barnes & Noble, 2005).  Introduction and Notes by Susan Ostrov Weisser. -- ePUB

* LADY CHATTERLEY'S LOVER: Complete and Unabridged (Grove, 1959).  Introduction by Mark Schorer.

* LADY CHATTERLEY'S LOVER (Modern Library, 1993). -- ePUB

* THE LOST GIRL (Penguin, 1978)

* THE MAN WHO DIED [The Escaped Cock] (Heinemann, 1950).  Introduction by Richard Aldington.

* MR. NOON (Viking, 1985).  Edited by Lindeth Vasey with an Introduction by Melvyn Bragg.

* THE PLUMED SERPENT [Quetzalcoatl] (Vintage, 1955).

* QUETZALCOATL (New Directions, 1958).  Edited with an Introduction by Louis L. Martz.

* THE RAINBOW (Oxford World's Classics, 1997).  Edited with Introduction and Notes by Kate Flint. -- ePUB

* THE RAINBOW (Penguin, 1986).

* SONS AND LOVERS (Barnes & Noble, 2003).  Introduction and Notes by Victoria Blake. -- ePUB

* SONS AND LOVERS (Penguin, 1994).  Edited with an Introduction and Notes by Helen Baron and Carl Baron.

* SONS AND LOVERS: Text, Background and Criticism (Viking Critical Edition, 1968).  Edited by Julian Moynahan.

* THE TRESPASSER (Viking, 1983).  Edited by Elizabeth Mansfield.

* THE WHITE PEACOCK (Heinemann, 1911)

* WOMEN IN LOVE (Barnes & Noble, 2005).  Introduction and Notes by Norman Loftis. -- ePUB

* WOMEN IN LOVE (Penguin, 1995).  Edited by David Farmer, Lindeth Vasey and John Worthen, with an Introduction and Notes by Mark Kinkead-Weekes.



                        == Short Stories, Novellas, and Plays ==

* THE COMPLETE SHORT STORIES (Penguin, 1976-1977).  3 vols.

* FOUR SHORT NOVELS: Love Among the Haystacks / The Ladybird / The Fox / The Captain's Doll (Viking, 1965).  

* THREE PLAYS: A Collier's Friday Night / The Daughter-in-Law / The Widowing of Mrs Holroyd (Penguin, 1969).  Introduction by Raymond Williams.

* THE VIRGIN AND THE GIPSY & OTHER STORIES (Cambridge UP,  2006).  Edited by Michael Herbert, Bethan Jones, and Lindeth Vasey.



                          == Non-fiction, Travel & Letters ==

* APOCALYPSE (Viking, 1960).  Introduction by Richard Aldington.

* ETRUSCAN PLACES (Viking, 1957)

* INTRODUCTIONS AND REVIEWS (Cambridge UP, 2005).  Edited by N. H. Reeve and John Worthen.

* LATE ESSAYS AND ARTICLES (Cambridge UP, 2004).  Edited by James T. Boulton.

* MORNINGS IN MEXICO (Tauris, 2009)

* PHOENIX: The Posthumous Papers of D. H. Lawrence (Heinemann, 1936)

* PHOENIX II: Uncollected, Unpublished and Other Prose Works by D. H. Lawrence (Viking, 1968).  Edited with Introduction and Notes by Warren Roberts and Harry T. Moore.

* PSYCHOANALYSIS AND THE UNCONSCIOUS & FANTASIA OF THE UNCONSCIOUS (Cambridge UP, 2004).  Edited by Bruce Steele.

* REFLECTIONS ON THE DEATH OF A PORCUPINE & OTHER ESSAYS (Indiana, 1963)

* SEA AND SARDINIA (Penguin, 1976)

* SELECTED LETTERS (Penguin, 1978).  Selected by Richard Aldington with an Introduction by Aldous Huxley.

* SELECTED LITERARY CRITICISM (Viking, 1956).  Edited by Anthony Beal.

* SEX, LITERATURE, AND CENSORSHIP (Viking, 1959).  Edited by Harry T. Moore.

* STUDIES IN CLASSIC AMERICAN LITERATURE (Viking, 1961)

* TWILIGHT IN ITALY (Viking, 1958)


                                    == Other ==

* COMPLETE WORKS (Delphi Classics, 2012). -- ePUB

* THE PORTABLE D. H. LAWRENCE (Penguin, 1977).  Edited with an Introduction by Diana Trilling.
